Award.AwardTitle: Cyber Defense Bootcamp for High School Technology Teachers

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The need for more college graduates in cybersecurity is increasing. In order to facilitate cybersecurity education growth at undergraduate and graduate levels, programs and projects are needed to help attract and recruit college bound students to this field. This project will be part of a feasibility study investigating types of activities, pedagogy, target audience, scale, evaluation metrics and other factors of innovative projects to achieve this goal. The project will involve teacher professional development and promote improvement in cybersecurity education at the high school levels with two central goals: (1) attract and recruit college bound students to the field of cybersecurity; (2) produce more qualified students entering college programs of study in cybersecurity. All curricula, exercises, and activities developed, in whole or in part, as a result of this project will be available to the community through the NSF-sponsored RAVE Program and/or other dissemination channels.

The primary goal of this project is to organize a week long Cyber Defense Bootcamp for High School Technology Teachers. It will expose secondary school teachers to the principles of good cybersecurity practices and the science behind those practices so that they may both teach their students effective practices as well as motivate these students to study more cybersecurity in more detail as they move into their chosen disciplines in colleges and universities. The main objectives of this Bootcamp include:
1. Improve Cyber Security awareness of participating high school teachers and their students;
2. Provide participating teachers with the opportunity to learn the fundamentals of Cyber Security;
3. Provide participating teachers with a complete set of course material to use at their home institutions;
4. Provide mentoring and help creating Cyber Defense clubs;
5. Introduce teachers to the Cyber Patriot and other nationally organized high school Cyber Defense competitions and encourage them to participate.

POR.DRECONTENT:
• Improve Cyber Security awareness of participating high school teachers:

 Our lectures and hands-on-exercises covered some aspects of Cyber Law and ethics, Cyber Threats and what is at risk, and how users can better protect their systems and Networks.

  • Provide participating teachers with the opportunity to learn the fundamentals of Cyber Security:

Our lectures and hands-on-exercises covered major areas of Cyber Security including System Security, Cryptography, Reconnaissance, Passport Cracking, Wireless Security, and Intrusion Detection and Recovery.

  • Provide participating teachers with a complete set of course material to take to their home institutions:

We have given the participants soft copies of all our lectures and lab exercises. Paper copies of all the hands-on exercises were also given to all participants, ahead of the practice session, so they could follow the instructions easier and take notes. Also we gave them an electronic copy of the “First Principles”.

  • Provide participating teachers mentoring help so they can introduce Cyber Security topics in the courses they teach and help them create Cyber Defense clubs, so their students learn how to better protect their systems for many years to come:

Our Cyber defense Club members and us have offered our help, any time during the year, as teachers are introducing Cyber Security in their courses or organizing Cyber Defense Clubs at their schools. Participants were given contact information of our Cyber Defense club members helping in the Bootcamp. Teachers are encouraged to contact us and/or our Cyber Defense club members, for help during the school year.

  • Introduce teachers to the CyberPatroit and other nationally organized high school Cyber Defense competitions and encourage them to participate:

We talked about CyberPatriot and we stressed the importance of sending teams to CyberPatriot competition. Our lab exercises and the lectures should help them prepare their students for the competition.


Last Modified: 12/27/2016
Modified by: Mohammad H Heydari
